body: @pcadabam @liyinan926 Did the requested modifications to the code. Can you review?
Please add a unit test to check the new plain/strong encryption functionality.
@xkrogen I will take a look after you update this PR with the fixes.
@ydailinkedin @liyinan926 please take a look when you have time.
LGTM other than the minor comments.
@zliu41 @liyinan926  Updated with an almost entirely new implementation that can handle the Writer outputting multiple files
@zliu41 pushed a new version that renames the files within the writer so no information needs to be passed from writer to publisher
In `LocalTaskStateTracker2.onTaskCompletion`, should `task.markTaskCompletion();` be moved to a finally block to make sure it is called?
`task.markTaskCompletion` should only be called if all retries fail. So calling it in a finally clause is not appropriate. What we can do is to make sure it is called if any `Throwable` is thrown.
So should it be put in a `catch(Throwable t)` block?
For `ParallelRunnerTest`, you can change `TaskState` to `WorkUnitState` and move it to under `gobblin-utility`.
@liyinan926 updated javadoc. Couldn't change `TaskState` to `WorkUnitState` since `WorkUnitState` doesn't have `setStartTime` or `setEndTime`.

@liyinan926 Updated. Now both `BaseDataPublisher` and `JobLauncherUtils` uses a `map` from Fs URI to `ParallelRunner`, which enables different tasks to share the same `ParallelRunner` if they use the same `FileSystem`. Also updated the unit test for `ParallelRunner`.
I'm a bit confused, shouldn't gobblin-runtime itself handle the distributed cache?

Travis build failed because line 408 `workUnit.setProp(ConfigurationKeys.TASK_ID_KEY, multiTaskId);` caused all wrapped `WorkUnit`s to have the same task ID, given the changes in this PR. So you need to fix that. You can remove that line and use `workUnit.getId()` in line 412 instead of reading the value of `ConfigurationKeys.TASK_ID_KEY`.
@zliu41 can you review? It's very quick.
@ibuenros Compaction does not use Gobblin runtime. It's something completely independent, similar as Camus daily sweeper..

I removed lines 405-411, I'm not sure if setting a property on a `MultiWorkUnit` actually does anything in the original implementation, since the `MultiWorkUnit` is serialized right in the next code block, the 'workUnit.setProp(ConfigurationKeys.TASK_ID_KEY, multiTaskId);' property will get dropped during serialization.
Ignore the most recent changes please
I messed up the commit history, will make a new PR.

Why do we need to have a source and extractor for the old API?
If we must have them, I suggest using `OldApiHadoopFileInputSource` for old API, and use `HadoopFileInputSource` for the new API since new API should be used much more often.
The old APIs are still widely used in the community so it's good to support them. Yes, I can make the naming changes.
LGTM other than the only comment.
Addressed comments and fixed build after the naming changes.
Updated. Also added a prefix to config key names so there's less chance of naming conflicts.
Yes, sorry I will take a look today.

It looks good. Is there any use case where we would want to set a property in the MultiWorkUnit, but not for it to spread to the WorkUnits? If so, we could add a separate method to allow for that, but I can't  think of any such use case.
@sahilTakiar it would be great if you can take a look asap, as I need this to be checked in for the Lynda source. Thanks!
I can't think of a use case either, but it may be nice to have, I can add such a method.
Just a few comments, otherwise LGTM.
Your wiki is really nice. You should move it to github once the code gets merged.
Seems all `MRJobLauncherTest` tests are failing. @zliu41 can you first resolve those?

@liyinan926 updated. Since `WriterUtils.getDefaultWriterFilePath` requires the input `State` object to be either `WorkUnit` or `WorkUnitState`, I needed to change `State combinedState` to `WorkUnit fatWorkUnit`.
LGTM other than the only comment.
Missing open source header, otherwise LGTM.
